params.text: Little Cicada loved to sing.
Little Cicada wants to learn a new song.
She visited Kingfisher to learn a new song.
“Doo-oo-oo! Doo-oo-oo!” sang Kingfisher. But Little Cicada could not sing his song.
She then visited Mynah. Maybe she could learn to sing Mynah's song.
“Keak! Kaek! Kaek!” sang Mynah. But Cicada could not sing Mynah's song.
Cicada visits Cricket. Cicada wanted to learn a new song!
“Krik krik krik! Krik krik krik!” Cicada can’t learn Cricket’s song.
Then it started to rain. The ducks sang, “Quack! Quack! Quack!”
Frog came out and croaked, “Ribbit! Ribbit! Ribbit!”
All the animals came out and sang.
Cicada sang her song. “Yaeng! Yaeng! Yaeng!”
All the animals sang together!
Cicada sings only songs she can sing.

"Cicada's Song" credits

This work, "Cicada's Song", is a derivative of "Cicada's Song" translated by Alisha Berger used under CC BY.  It is based on the Original story: 'ສຽງເພງຂອງຈັກຈັ່ນນ້ອຍ', by Khomsanh Chanthalangsone. © Room to Read, 2015. 

Some changes were made to this work. "Cicada's Song" is licensed under CC BY 4.0 by Curious Learning.


Book builder - Deborah Oduman
